clinical_study.official_title: Direct Colposcopic Vision and Large Loop Excision of the Transformation Zone in Women With Cervical Dysplasia: a Randomized Controlled Trial.

lead_sponsor.agency: Zydolab - Institute of Cytology and Immune Cytochemistry

clinical_study.source: Zydolab - Institute of Cytology and Immune Cytochemistry

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the benefits of large Loop excision of the transformation Zone (LLETZ) under direct colposcopic Vision.

primary_outcome.description: the resected cone mass will be quantified by weighing the removed tissue with a precision scale located in the operating room

secondary_outcome.description: Resection margin is judge as "R0" if abnormal cells are not found in the margin of the biopsy or "R1" if abnormal cells remain in the margin of the biopsy. The histopathological examination will be done by an Independent pathologist
the time from the beginning of the Operation (start of the electrosurgical method) until the end of the operation (the end of hemostatic interventions) will be measured in minutes
Operative complications defined as necessity to intervene therapeutically up to 14 days postoperatively

secondary_outcome.measure: number of fragments of the surgical specimen
secondary_outcome.description: surgeons will count the number of the surgical specimen (1 vs. >1)

secondary_outcome.measure: the dimensions of the surgical specimens
secondary_outcome.description: The circumference, length and thickness of The surgical specimens will be measured
surgeons will score their preference regarding the surgical method using an 11-step visual analogue scale (VAS) for ,(ranging from 0 (,very easy') to 10 (,very difficult')

surgeons will score their preference regarding the surgical method using an 11-step visual analogue scale (VAS) for ,satisfaction with the device' (ranging from 0 (,very satisfied') to 10 (,absolutely not satisfied')
the time until complete hemostasis as judged by the surgeon has been achieved, will be measured in seconds
intraoperative blood loss will be measured using the difference in serum hemoglobin one day prior to surgery and within 5 hours postoperatively

arm_group.description: The LLETZ procedure will be performed under direct colposcopic vision
The LLETZ procedure will be performed without colposcopy

intervention.description: Loop procedure using a colposcope in order to see and remove the abnormal cervical tissue
Loop procedure without using a colposcope

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- histologically proven cervical dysplasia
- colposcopy Prior to conization
- informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- significant language barrier
- a personal history of conization
- pregnancy
- the use of blood thinner
- unwillingness to participate
